meanings.definition: A type of grass found in wetlands.
meanings.sent1: The sacatons swayed gently in the breeze near the pond.
meanings.sent2: We saw many sacatons growing by the marsh.
meanings.sent3: The ducks seemed to enjoy hiding among the tall sacatons.
meanings.sent4: The sacatons stood like a green army guarding the edge of the water.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant green color of the sacatons contrasted beautifully with the dark water.

meanings.sent1: The field was covered in sacatons, stretching as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent2: Farmers gathered the sacatons to feed their livestock.
meanings.sent3: The children played hide-and-seek among the tall sacatons, giggling.
meanings.sent4: The sacatons in the meadow whispered secrets to the wind.
meanings.sent5: The golden hue of the setting sun bathed the sacatons in a warm light.
